page.title: 06Corston Garage
page.content: There is an{Amoco Garage}on the main road in Corston, owned by{Mr. Budd and {Mr. Chandler.}Mr. Budd told us that he had owned it for sixteen years, although there has been a garage there for thirty-five years.When he started, petrol was 15p. a gallon; now it is Â£2. He gets two hundred customers on a busy day, and sells Â£12,000 worth of petrol every week. He has six full time and four part-time workers. He sells about 100 new Ford cars every year, and all sorts of second hand ones. The garage services and repairs cars and tyres, and does M.O.T. tests. There is also a shop which sells refreshments, to motorists. Mr. Budd said he enjoyed his job, and thought Ford cars were excellent.
